title: Drawing, Design for Store Facade of Mappin &Weeb in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925
title_raw: Design for Store Facade of Mappin &Weeb in the Art Deco Style
medium: Graphite, brush and dark green watercolor, white gouache on green paperboard
markings: At lower right, small [1/2 x 1 in.] copyright stamp in black:   LEY  7092/9510/DE PROTECCION/ A LA/PROPIEDAD/ARTISTICA
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite above left vitrin : Or Febreria [Goldwork]; above right vitrine,  Plateria [Silverwork]; in graphite, lower right,  K
description: Facade with an elegant two-storied entrance flanked by storefront windows, trimmed with dark marble.  The deep central entrance is beneath a curved marquee (with striking zig-zag pattern in white), which, in turn, is surmounted by an arched overdoor (the latter being like a stepped proscenium framing the central area with the name of the shop).  Little lights or silver plated plaques boarder the proscenium and continue along the top of the vitrines.  Each window has curtains on upper portion of rear wall.  Suggestions of plates and other objects are within the display areas.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Store Facade of Mappin &Weeb in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925. Graphite, brush and dark green watercolor, white gouache on green paperboard. 
Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-23.
